title: Motorbike and car crash: Motorcyclist trapped under car in Woodville West
text:
A rider has been critically injured and his motorbike thrown across a main road following a crash in Adelaide’s West.

Emergency services were called to Gawler Rd in Woodville West just before 7.30pm on Sunday.

Initial reports were that a motorcyclist was left pinned after crashing into a parked car.

The man’s motorbike was sent flying across Findon Rd, coming to rest on the opposite pavement, its front light still working despite the force of the collision.

media_camera Police gather at the scene of a serious crash in Woodville West.

The man suffered critical injuries and MedStar personnel were at the scene treating him.

Major Crash investigators are attending the scene.

Northbound traffic on Findon Road has been blocked off at Trimmer Parade along with Gawler Street.

Extensive traffic restrictions are in place and motorists are asked to avoid the road if possible.
description: A motorcyclist has been critically injured and his bike thrown 50m across a main road after he crashed into a parked car in Woodville West.
